tit.cmt: スペースを修正しました。

sen.j: 来目皇子（くめのみこ、生年不詳 - 推古天皇11年2月4日 (旧暦)（603年3月25日））は、飛鳥時代の皇族。
sen.e: Kumenomiko (date of birth unknown, died on March 25, 603) was an Imperial Family member during the Asuka Period.
Kumenomiko (year of birth unknown - March 25, 603) was an Imperial Family member during the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。Period→period と修正しました。
sen.e: Kumenomiko (year of birth unknown - March 25, 603) was an Imperial Family member during the Asuka period.
He is also known as Kumeo
He is also known as Kumeo.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: He is also known as Kumeo.
His father was Emperor Yomei.
His father was the Emperor Yomei.
His father was the Emperor Yomei.
His mother was Anahobe no Hashihitohime.
His mother was Anahobe no Hashihitohime.
His mother was Anahobe no Hashihitohime.
Prince Shotoku was his older half brother born from the same mother.
The Prince Shotoku was his older brother-uterine.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。half brother born from the same mother→brother-uterine と修正しました。
sen.e: The Prince Shotoku was his older brother-uterine.

sen.j: 推古天皇10年（602年）2月、新羅征討将軍として軍二万五千を授けられる。
sen.e: In February 602, he was appointed Shiragi Seito Shogun (great general for subduing Shiragi (Silla)) and given an army of 25,000 soldiers.
In March 602, he was appointed to Shiragi Seito Shogun (great general for subduing Shiragi [Silla]) and given an army of 25,000 soldiers.
sen.cmt: 推古天皇10年（602年）2月→西暦602年3月と修正しました。appointed→appointed to と修正しました。カッコ内を修正しました。
sen.e: In March 602, he was appointed to Shiragi Seito Shogun (great general for subduing Shiragi [Silla]) and given an army of 25,000 soldiers.

sen.j: 4月に軍を率いて筑紫国に至り、志摩郡 (筑前国)に屯営したが、6月に病気を得て新羅への進軍を延期とした。
sen.e: In April in the same year, leading the army, he reached Tsukushi Province and stationed in Shima County (Chikuzen Province), but had to postopone his military advance to Shiragi after falling ill in June.

In April in the same year, leading the army, he reached Tsukushi Province and stationed in Shima County (Chikuzen Province), but had to postpone his military advance to Shiragi after falling ill in June.

In April in the same year, leading the army, he reached Tsukushi Province and stationed in Shima County (Chikuzen Province), but had to postpone his military advance to Shiragi after falling ill in June.

sen.j: 征討を果たせぬまま、翌年（603年）2月4日、筑紫にて薨去。
sen.e: Before completing his mission of conquesting Shiragi, he died in Tsukushi Province on February 4, 603.
Before completing his mission of conquering Shiragi, he died in Tsukushi Province on March 24, 603.
sen.cmt: 翌年（603年）2月4日→西暦603年3月24日と修正しました。conquesting→conquering と修正しました。
sen.e: Before completing his mission of conquering Shiragi, he died in Tsukushi Province on March 25, 603.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変換すると確かに603年3月24日なのですが、それだと最初の「生年不詳 - 推古天皇11年2月4日 (旧暦)（603年3月25日））」と合わないので、3月25日のほうに統一しました。

sen.j: 周防国の佐波郡 (山口県)（遺称地は山口県防府市桑山）に殯（もがり）し、土師猪手（はじのいて）がこれを管掌した。
sen.e: His funeral was organized by Haji no Ite and took place in Sawa County (Yamaguchi Prefecture) (the site is now located in Hofu City, Yamaguchi Prefecture.)
His funeral was organized by Haji no Ite and took place in Sawa County (Yamaguchi Prefecture) (Kuwanoyama, Hofu City, Yamaguchi Prefecture is traditionally believed to be the place.)
sen.cmt: 「桑山（くわのやま）」を補いました。”遺称地＝遺構・遺跡があったと古くから伝わる地”との意を汲み修正しました。
sen.e: His funeral was organized by Haji no Ite and took place in Sawa County (Yamaguchi Prefecture) (Kuwanoyama, Hofu City, Yamaguchi Prefecture is traditionally believed to be the place.)

sen.j: 河内国埴生山（はにゅうのやま）岡上に葬られた。
sen.e: His body was buried at the top of Hanyu-no-yama Mountain in Kawachi Province.
His body was buried at the top of Hanyu-no-yama Mountain in Kawachi Province.
sen.cmt: OK”埴生山（はにゅうのやま）岡上”は地名ではないかと思うのですが、確認は取れませんでした。
sen.e: His body was buried at the top of Hanyu-no-yama Mountain in Kawachi Province.

sen.j: 現在、同墓は大阪府羽曳野市はびきの三丁目の塚穴古墳（方墳・一辺約50m）に比定され、宮内庁の管理下にある。
sen.e: Today, a cave tumulus (a square tumulus of about 50 meters on the side) located in 3-chome, Habikino, Habikino City, Osaka Prefecture has been identified as Kumenomiko's tumulus and it is under the management of the Imperial Household Agency..

Today, a cave tomb (a square tomb of about 50 meters on the side) located in 3-chome, Habikino, Habikino City, Osaka Prefecture has been identified as Kumenomiko's mausoleum, and it is under the management of the Imperial Household Agency.
sen.cmt: tumulus→tomb,スペースを修正しました。tumulus→mausoleum と修正しました。カンマを補い、ピリオドを修正しました。
sen.e: Today, a cave tomb (a square tomb of about 50 meters on the side) located in 3-chome, Habikino, Habikino City, Osaka Prefecture has been identified as Kumenomiko's mausoleum, and it is under the management of the Imperial Household Agency.
